required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of Telitacicept Treatment in Primary APS Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm pilot study in Peking Union Medical College Hospital. Telitacicept will be added on traditional antithrombotic and immunosuppressive treatment in primary antiphospholipid syndrome (APS) patients with three positive antiphospholipid antibodies (aPL) and at least one extra-criteria manifestations, including thrombocytopenia, autoimmune hemolytic anemia, aPL associated nephropathy, heart valvular disease, non-stroke neurological manifestations. This study aims to evaluate the efficacy of Telitacicept in preventing thrombosis and improving extra-criteria manifestations on high-risk APS patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study started on July 2021 and will last 1.5 years. Primary APS patients with three positive aPL and extra-criteria manifestations with be enrolled. This is a single-arm pilot study. Telitacicept 160mg once a week for 24 weeks will be added on traditional antithrombotic and immunosuppressive treatment. Patients will be followed on week 12 and week 24. The primary endpoint is new thrombotic event. The secondary endpoints are improvement of extra-criteria manifestations, and titer change of aPL.

primary_outcome.description: any new thrombotic event during Telitacicept treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: improvement of thrombocytopenia during Telitacicept treatment
improvement of hemolytic anemia during Telitacicept treatment
improvement of aPL nephropathy during Telitacicept treatment
improvement of valve heart disease during Telitacicept treatment
secondary_outcome.description: decrease of valve thickness or vegetation by echocardiogram

secondary_outcome.measure: improvement of neurological manifestations during Telitacicept treatment
decrease of aPL titer during Telitacicept treatment
secondary_outcome.description: titer change of lupus anticoagulant, anticardiolipin antibody and anti-β2 glycoprotein-I antibody

arm_group.description: Telitacicept 160mg once a week for 24 week as an add-on treatment regimen.
